text:
This looks like an installable web app (Google calls them progressive web apps) that you can "add to desktop" or "add to home screen" from the browser.

But Pluto doesn't seem to support that, so maybe this is pluto on binder, as an installed app.

elements.text:
This looks like an installable web app (Google calls them progressive web apps) that you can "add to desktop" or "add to home screen" from the browser.

But Pluto doesn't seem to support that, so maybe this is pluto on binder, as an installed app.
Nope, not binder either...

text: It should be exactly that (a progressive web app), you should be able to see a small button at the right end of your address bar (at least in chrome), which you can click to install it. It's not any faster than your browser though

elements.text: It should be exactly that (a progressive web app), you should be able to see a small button at the right end of your address bar (at least in chrome), which you can click to install it. It's not any faster than your browser though

text:
Sad！I hope Midori rolls out their newer WebKit based browsers soon (I heard that the current usage of Electron was experimental and that they intend to return to WebKit)

Also, I think my own system is kinda slow. Also, KDE comes with Nvidia support for Wayland, in Fedora 34 late April. I hope Wayland is a smoother experience.

elements.text:
Sad！I hope Midori rolls out their newer WebKit based browsers soon (I heard that the current usage of Electron was experimental and that they intend to return to WebKit)

Also, I think my own system is kinda slow. Also, KDE comes with Nvidia support for Wayland, in Fedora 34 late April. I hope Wayland is a smoother experience.

text: tbf your browser plays a very small role performance-wise so I would be very surprised if that’s where your bottleneck is. your cpu/gpu/ram matters much more, best to look for upgrades there

elements.text: tbf your browser plays a very small role performance-wise so I would be very surprised if that’s where your bottleneck is. your cpu/gpu/ram matters much more, best to look for upgrades there
